Title: Energy Market - Analyst - Madrid
RoleDescription:

Title: Project Management Consultancy (PMC) Roles for Large-scale Cryogenic Storage Tank Project in Thailand
RoleDescription:
The project involves the Project Management Consultancy (PMC) services for the construction of refrigerated storage facilities in Thailand. The PMC team will manage and supervise the EPCC contractor to ensure design integrity, safety, quality, cost control, and timely project completion. The PMC scope includes engineering reviews, procurement coordination, construction oversight, SHE management, commissioning support, and process safety compliance.The project will have large-scale cryogenic storage tank along with associated facilities for liquid storage, send-out systems, and marine operations. The Engineering Manager will lead the engineering review and management team within the PMC organization. Procurement ManagerRole Overview:
The Procurement Manager will oversee all procurement activities, ensuring timely sourcing, vendor selection, and coordination with the engineering team and EPCC contractor.Key Responsibilities:Lead procurement planning, RFQ processes, bid evaluation, and vendor selection in coordination with the engineering team.Review vendor technical documents and ensure compliance with project specifications.Monitor and expedite the EPCC contractor's procurement schedules to meet project timelines.Coordinate with logistics, quality control, and engineering to ensure seamless vendor and materials management.Identify risks in the supply chain and develop mitigation strategies for potential delays.Requirements:12+ years of procurement experience in EPC or PMC projects (preferably LNG or refrigerated storage).Strong communication and negotiation skills (English proficiency required).Based in Thailand, with hands-on experience in vendor management and procurement planning.3. SHE ManagerRole Overview:
The SHE Manager will implement and enforce Safety, Health, and Environment (SHE) systems for the project. This role ensures that all EPCC contractor activities adhere to project safety policies, Thai regulations, and international standards.Key Responsibilities:Develop and implement SHE policies, plans, and procedures across the project.Conduct risk assessments, safety audits, and incident investigations.Coordinate closely with EPCC contractors to ensure compliance with EHS standards and EIA/EHIA requirements.Monitor construction activities, including hazardous material handling, to prevent SHE incidents.Conduct safety training and awareness programs for all site personnel.Requirements:10+ years of experience in SHE roles for major EPC or PMC projects.Valid Safety Officer License (Thailand) is required.Strong experience in cryogenic or petrochemical construction projects preferred.Good English communication and reporting skills.4. Process Safety ManagerRole Overview:
The Process Safety Manager will be responsible for hazard identification, process risk management, and safety assurance during all project phases.Key Responsibilities:Lead HAZOP, HAZID, LOPA, and SIL studies and ensure all safety recommendations are implemented.Oversee the design and verification of safety instrumented systems (SIS) and emergency shutdown procedures.Review EPCC contractor's process design for compliance with safety codes (API, NFPA, IEC).Support Pre-Start-up Safety Reviews (PSSR) and ensure operational readiness from a safety standpoint.Collaborate with the SHE Manager for integrated safety management.Requirements:10+ years of process safety experience in LNG/petrochemical/cryogenic storage projects.COE license and functional safety certification (e.g., TUV) preferred.Based in Thailand with strong English proficiency.Proven record in managing process safety studies for EPCC projects.Minimum Criteria & Requirements (Applicable to All Roles)Education: Bachelor's degree in Engineering is required; a Masters or MBA is preferred.Experience: Minimum of 12+ years in the relevant engineering or management discipline.PMC Experience: Must have hands-on experience in Project Management Consultancy (PMC) roles, specifically in LNG or Ethane projects.Certifications: Professional certifications such as Chartered Engineer, PMP, or discipline-specific credentials are highly preferred.Leadership & Communication: Strong stakeholder management, team leadership, and cross-functional coordination skills are essential.Relocation: Willingness to relocate to Thailand for the full project duration is required.Location & Benefits:Location: The position is based in Bangkok, with potential opportunities for regional travel as required.Competitive Salary: Attractive salary package based on experience and qualifications, along with performance-based incentives.Additional Benefits: Comprehensive health and wellness benefits, professional development opportunities, and a supportive work environment that encourages career growth.Dynamic Work Environment: Be a part of a collaborative, innovative, and forward-thinking team, working on cutting-edge LNG and Green Fuels infrastructure projects.We offer the following to qualified candidates:Friendly international working environment with a wide variety of interesting and challenging tasksCompetitive salary packageCareer opportunity in one of the largest international consulting and engineering companiesPossibility to grow professionally and advance in careerPossibility to work in international renewable energy projectsAt AFRY, we engineer change in everything we do.
